result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob D. Steinmetz in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM29/22CM649. DE has still not be able to get his license and states he needs additional time. Court will adjourn to allow the DE to obtain a valid drivers license.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:02 AM
Defendant, Jacob D. Steinmetz, appeared.
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
22CM29 & 22CM649:
Updated def's new address & phone no. in ccap.
Defendant requesting more time to obtain DL.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob D. Steinmetz
Current: 2000 Dawn Lane, Zion, IL 60099 United States  (Effective: 07-19-2022)
Prior: 6013 Sheridan Rd Upper, Kenosha, WI 53143
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

02:46 PM recalled at 2:38 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:00 am. $250  Cash bond continued w/ additional conditions (see previous bond entry). mi
